column4: Need help solving some 12.04 unmet dependencies based on python-uno and libreoffice
did u get the dev packages?
boot into recovery, and run a dpkg -reconfigure -a
k will try
I am in recov but it does not like the dpkg -reconfigure -a option
do u have aptitude installed
maybe but ive had better success with aptitude
what command would you usse with aptitude
its a curses terminal program, its windowed, sorta
so u just run aptitude
okay I ran it and another term menu you came up
hit b
okay done - next
did broken packages come up
yes I red
package names higlighted in RED
open them up hitting enter, find out what they need by hitting down. i guess use apt-get to actually install the packages but you can use this as a tool to find what u need to install
I was able to remove the pakages using aptitude menu system
i guess that works lol
it aloowed me to remove the libreoffice and python-uno broken crap
which I could not so in the GUI or terminal windown in the GUI
well you may want to try reinstalling if u need an office type package
thanks for the help
no problem
